30063.name: Spaces
30063.description:
Insert and swap space instances in autolayouts.


Naming convention

In order for the plugin to find your spacing components and order them from the smallest to the largest, each spacing component should follow this convention: space_ + [value]

example: space_8 / space_16 / etc.


Inserting/Swapping

When clicking a space in the list, the output will differ based on the current selection (that can be multiple objects or layers).

  1. If an object or layer part of an autolayout is selected, the space instance will be insterted after/before it (according to the state of the position toggle).
  2. If a space instance is selected, the new space instance will replace it.
  3. If nothing or any another type of object or layer is selected, the space instance will be inserted in the center of the viewport.


Visibility

The visibility toggle shows or hides the spacing instances that are part of the active selection.


This plugin was created for the AREA 17 design team and is a variation of the original Spacers plugin by the UX 82 team.

29322.name: Webhook Configurator
29322.description:
Create & manage your team's webhooks.


You can...

  • create webhooks for teams
  • show a list of webhooks for your teams
  • remove webhooks


Requirements

  • To manage a team's webhooks you need to be at least an administrator for that team.
  • You need to have a "Personal Access Token" (within Figma go to your avatar -> settings)
  • The team ID of the team for which to manage webhooks (currently only accessible from the browser version)


Notes

  • This plugin will receive more features/updates.
  • Webhooks are currently in Beta.
  • I'm not a designer myself. So pardon me for the horrible cover art/icon ğŸ˜…


Having feedback or questions? Just let me know ğŸ™‚


==FAQ==


Where do i find my Team ID's?

  1. Open your browser and navigate to Figma.
  2. On the left side select the team (click on it's name; don't select a project)
  3. In the browser's URL bar you can find the Team ID. It is right behind "...team/". E.g. https://www.figma.com/files/team/1234567890/xxx?fuid=8934... => Team ID is 1234567890
29322.release_notes:
- All event types are supported (File update, file version update, file deletion, file comments, library publishing).
- The event type can be selected from a dropdown.
- Improved error handling: users are shown toasts with some instructions.
- If creating a hook fails users are not navigated away anymore.
- Code cleanup & minor UI improvements

29167.name: Status Changer
29167.description:
Status Changer allows you to easily change the name of the person in charge and the modified date on your own Component set.


HOW TO USE

  1. Install `Status Changer` and run it inside of a project.
  2. Edit the Component Set created for the Status bar.(Note whether the item has been added to Variants.)
  3. Select the Frames, etc. to which you want to add a status bar and run Status Changer.
  4. You can select your own customized component set values, and the status bar(s) will be added when you select and press the SET button.
  5. After changing the status, click "Change user name and modification time." from the plugin in the properties screen on the right.


About Dates and Dates

Multiple country formats are supported, including American and British, Asian, etc.


Sample For January 2, 2022 at 11:03 p.m.


For the British "DD/MM/YY H.mm a" 02/01/22 11.03 pm

For the U.S. "MM-DD-YY H:mm a" 01-02-22 11:03 pm

For the Japan "YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm" 2022/01/02 23:03

Click Here For More Info! 


Caution

Be sure to place it directly below the page.

Do not rename the properties.

relaunchButtons.name: Change user name and modification time

29590.name: Page markup
29590.description: Mark the page and switch to the page

30212.name: Suggested Links
30212.description:
Generate links for your prototype based on your frame contents.


This experimental plugin is the result of an ongoing research project. It uses a probabilistic supervised classifier and an integer programming solver to suggest links for your prototype based on the frames' text content and color composition. As a result of its research status, errors can occur and unexpected results are common.


-----


> Note: This Figma plugin is part of a master thesis project titled "Assignment-Based Link Optimization in GUI Prototyping Using Incremental Supervised Classification" by Christoph A. Johns at German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) and Aalto University. The project is supervised by Michael Barz and Antti Oulasvirta. You can find the source code for all parts of this application on GitHub ([classifier](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links-classifier), [optimizer](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links-optimizer), [plugin](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links), [paper](https://github.com/christophajohns/gui-links-as-assignment)).
30212.release_notes:
- Add custom backend URL settings
- Use Screen2Vec-based classification

29937.name: Position
29937.description: Set position and constraints with margin to center or corners.

28099.name: Quick Setup
28099.description: Quick Setup will create a few pages to get your indie project started.

30235.name: Figma Frames to CSV
30235.description:
Many cases we need to share the Figma Preview links of frames separately. This plugin will give you a separate list of visible frames. Even if there is a way to export the list as CSV file.


Features

This is a beta release of this project. Feel free to contribute and add new features. Currently the shortlist of features are -

- Export the whole list as CSV

- Copy link by clicking on the input field


How to Use

Go to plugins and click on "Figma Frames to CSV" It will show the list of links of your frames. Simply click on the links It will automatically copied into your clipboard.


Contact

Email - saadh393@gmail.com

Github - Saad Hasan

Website - Saad Hasan

28529.name: weblate integration
28529.description:
a plugin that checks for strings on weblate (translation tool) so design copy is updated with all website relevant locale data.


it integrates weblate self-hosted API to quality check design texts on figma and suggest possible already translated strings.

30187.name: [Alpha] Figma to Abstra converter
30187.description:
Use this plugin to create designs and copy them over directly to Abstra!


This is an open alpha. If you want to know more please contact us.

30074.name: toJSON
30074.description:
Converts current selections to json files. Also exports all images at original sizes.


The idea being that you can recreate the layout in your app automatically, if you add the ability to interpret json when you build your app.


Note that the json does not include everything, but it currently is enough to recreate the layout with some basic constraints, some more advanced constraints are not supported.

30333.name: Black and White
30333.description:
Make any frame grayscale.

  1. Select a frame
  2. Run this plugin
  3. ğŸ’¥Now that frame is black and whiteğŸ’¥


This is useful to show WIP designs, or to differentiate deprecated / old screens.

30319.name: Design VS Design
30319.description:
Compare ideas with your stakeholders and design with confidence.


Design VS Design enables designers to effortlessly test their ideas with visual A/B surveys. The simple format of A/B surveys compels the testers into expressing their opinion leaving you with clean reports & insights to explore. Just select two layers you want to survey and activate the plugin. 


Ideal for: 

  • Testing visual iterations
  • Testing redesigns
  • Quick UI reviews 


How to use it: 

  1. Select 2 layers, groups, or frames and invoke the plugin.
  2. Customize the question, option names, and background color.
  3. Click Upload & share the link with your testers. 


(You do not need an account on Design VS Design to use this plugin)

30296.name: Wisdom Lint
30296.description:
Find and fix errors in Designs.

 

-Use this Plugin to find missing styles and other errors within our designs.

 

-Ensure your designs are ready for development by fixing inconsistencies.

 

-Rules for Names: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BbAbYRq0pK-QpuZCdug2X7EQF6SU1ZA4hFfYC55Cjns/edit?usp=sharing

 

While it's running, Fisdom Design Lint will update automatically as you fix errors. Clicking on the layer will also select that layer in your design. Navigating between each error is fast and much easier than trying to find errors on your own.

 

  • Errors are displayed in a layer list, or you can view them in a list sorted by how often they occur(inside Errors by type).
  • Use the "Select All" option to fix multiple errors at once.
  • Ignore and Ignore All allow you to ignore special unique layers.
  • Have an illustration in your design? Use the "Lock" layer feature in figma to skip it from being linted.
  • Want to set your own border radius values? Open the settings panel in the plugin.
  • Select any layer/screen/file and run Plugin



General Rules:

Name: Name should be given as per rules

Color: Color should be used from foundation only

Fonts: Fonts should be used from foundation only

Radius: It should be given from fixed values

Margin/Padding/Width/Height: Skipped in Linting

Effects/Strokes: Can't use other than foundation, Skipped in Linting

Spacer: Skipped in Linting

Rectangle/Ellipse: Skipped in Linting


Exceptions:

-For all the icons components, we will use iv as a prefix and not the actual component name (32px_icon etc.)

-We will skip rectangle/ellipse from Linting 

-Skipping ios bottom/status bar from Linting

30086.name: Frontdrop
30086.description:
Messy transition from design to code? we got you.

Import designs from Figma or create your components with our drag and drop editor, set props, animations, and ship them.


Steps:

  1. Design your component in figma
  2. Add frontdropio to your plugins
  3. Select your design and open the plugin

30315.name: FeedLabs
30315.description:
The FeedLabs plugin helps you to quickly render a template for many items in an item list. 


How to

1) Create a template (frame), using Figma

2) Upload a CSV file with your items, using the plugin

3) Render the frame for all items in a few seconds


Features

  • Dynamic images; use image URLs to show a different image per item
  • Dynamic text; use fields inside text elements to show different text per item. (e.g. ${{price}},-)
  • Conditional rendering; show an element depending on a certain condition (e.g. 'sale' EQUAL true)
  • Render up to 50 items in a few seconds
  • Make infinite templates and designs, using Figma


FAQ

What is the pricing model?

The plugin in the current state will always be available for free.


What if I want to add more than 50 items?

Currently we only offer a free service, this free service only allows limited features. Soon we are launching a service allowing the processing of more than 100.000s of items.


Something is not working as expected, what do I do?

We love feedback! Please send an email to vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl and I will personally help you.


I need a feature which is not implemented, what do I do?

We are currently working very hard implementing many new features. However, if you have some useful suggestions, please send the to me at vanamerongen@squaremoon.nl.




Powered by SquareMoon B.V.

30366.name: Setup Zap
30366.description: (MVP) A blazing fast boilerplate generator for UI/UX Designers!
